    double[][]
    lowpassfilter(int nRows, int nCols, float cutoff, int n)
    Constructs a low-pass butterworth filter 1 f = -------------------- 1.0 + (w/cutoff)^(2n) The frequency origin of the returned filter is at the corners.

  • Method Details

    • lowpassfilter

      public double[][] lowpassfilter(int nRows, int nCols, float cutoff, int n)
      Constructs a low-pass butterworth filter 1 f = -------------------- 1.0 + (w/cutoff)^(2n) The frequency origin of the returned filter is at the corners.
      Parameters:
      nRows - number of rows to use in filter
      nCols - number of columns to use in filter
      cutoff - cutoff frequency of the filter, 0 to 0.5
      n - is the order of the filter, the higher n is the sharper the transition is. (n must be an integer >= 1). Note that n is doubled so that it is always an even integer.
      Returns:
